title: Stroopwafels
shortDescription: Enjoy the irresistible Dutch delight of thin waffle cookies with a gooey caramel-like syrup filling.

instructions.instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine 2 1/4 cups of all-purpose flour, 1/2 teaspoon of active dry yeast, 1/2 cup of warm milk, 1/4 cup of melted unsalted butter, 1/4 cup of granulated sugar, and a pinch of salt.
Mix until the dough comes together. Cover the bowl with a clean kitchen towel and let it rest for 1 hour, allowing the dough to rise.
While the dough is resting, make the syrup filling. In a saucepan, combine 1 cup of brown sugar, 1/2 cup of unsalted butter, 1 tablespoon of cinnamon, and a pinch of salt.
Cook over medium heat until the mixture becomes smooth and caramel-like. Remove from heat and let it cool slightly.
Preheat your stroopwafel iron or regular waffle iron.
Divide the dough into small balls. Place a ball on the preheated iron, close the lid, and cook until golden brown.
Remove the waffle and immediately cut it into a thin disk using a round cutter. While still warm, split the disk in half horizontally.
Spread a generous amount of the prepared syrup filling on one half and top it with the other half, creating a sandwich. Press gently to allow the syrup to spread to the edges.
Allow the stroopwafels to cool and the syrup to set. Repeat the process with the remaining dough and filling.
Serve these delicious stroopwafels with a hot cup of coffee or tea. Enjoy the sweet and chewy experience of this Dutch delicacy!

body: Stroopwafels are a delightful Dutch treat that brings together the crunchiness of thin waffle cookies and the sweetness of a gooey caramel-like syrup filling. These are perfect for enjoying a cozy moment with friends and family.
